fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Public Health, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: sustainable health topics; research (data)infrastructures; H2020/KP9; Cohesion policy post-2020
organisation_name: Netherlands Federation of University Medical Centres (NFU)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit: The Netherlands Federation of University Medical Centres (Nederlandse Federatie van Universitair Medische Centra) (NFU) represents the eight cooperating UMCs in the Netherlands, as an advocate for and employer of 65,000 people. The NFU was founded in 2004 as a spin-off from the University Hospitals Association (Vereniging Academische Ziekenhuizen) (VAZ), which was established in 1989. The objective has remained the same: to ensure that agencies that decide healthcare issues in the Netherlands take into account the special role of the academic hospitals (in the past) and the UMCs (presently).
relevant_communication:
-communication and positioning of NFU (thematic) priorities 
-networking with relevant EU organisations and stakeholders
